deepof.train_utils module

Simple utility functions used in deepof example scripts. These are not part of the main package

class deepof.train_utils.CustomStopper(start_epoch, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: keras.callbacks.EarlyStopping

Custom early stopping callback. Prevents the model from stopping before warmup is over

__init__(start_epoch, *args, **kwargs)
get_config()

Updates callback metadata

on_epoch_end(epoch, logs=None)

Called at the end of an epoch.

Subclasses should override for any actions to run. This function should only be called during TRAIN mode.

Parameters

  • epoch – Integer, index of epoch.

  • logs –

    Dict, metric results for this training epoch, and for the

    validation epoch if validation is performed. Validation result keys are prefixed with val_. For training epoch, the values of the

    Model’s metrics are returned. Example`{‘loss’: 0.2, ‘accuracy’:

    0.7}`.

deepof.train_utils.load_treatments(train_path)

Loads a dictionary containing the treatments per individual, to be loaded as metadata in the coordinates class

deepof.train_utils.get_callbacks(X_train: numpy.array, batch_size: int, phenotype_prediction: float, next_sequence_prediction: float, supervised_prediction: float, overlap_loss: float, loss: str, loss_warmup: int = 0, warmup_mode: str = 'none', input_type: str = False, cp: bool = False, reg_cat_clusters: bool = False, reg_cluster_variance: bool = False, entropy_knn: int = 100, logparam: Optional[dict] = None, outpath: str = '.', run: int = False) → List[Any]

Generates callbacks for model training, including: - run_ID: run name, with coarse parameter details; - tensorboard_callback: for real-time visualization; - cp_callback: for checkpoint saving; - onecycle: for learning rate scheduling; - entropy: neighborhood entropy in the latent space;

deepof.train_utils.log_hyperparameters(phenotype_class: float, rec: str)

Blueprint for hyperparameter and metric logging in tensorboard during hyperparameter tuning

deepof.train_utils.tensorboard_metric_logging(run_dir: str, hpms: Any, ae: Any, X_val: numpy.ndarray, y_val: numpy.ndarray, next_sequence_prediction: float, phenotype_prediction: float, supervised_prediction: float, rec: str)

Autoencoder metric logging in tensorboard

deepof.train_utils.autoencoder_fitting(preprocessed_object: Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray], embedding_model: str, batch_size: int, encoding_size: int, epochs: int, hparams: dict, kl_annealing_mode: str, kl_warmup: int, log_history: bool, log_hparams: bool, loss: str, mmd_annealing_mode: str, mmd_warmup: int, montecarlo_kl: int, n_components: int, output_path: str, overlap_loss: float, next_sequence_prediction: float, phenotype_prediction: float, supervised_prediction: float, pretrained: str, save_checkpoints: bool, save_weights: bool, reg_cat_clusters: bool, reg_cluster_variance: bool, entropy_knn: int, input_type: str, run: int = 0, strategy: tensorflow.python.distribute.distribute_lib.Strategy = 'one_device')

Implementation function for deepof.data.coordinates.deep_unsupervised_embedding

deepof.train_utils.tune_search(data: List[numpy.array], encoding_size: int, hypertun_trials: int, hpt_type: str, k: int, kl_warmup_epochs: int, loss: str, mmd_warmup_epochs: int, overlap_loss: float, next_sequence_prediction: float, phenotype_prediction: float, supervised_prediction: float, project_name: str, callbacks: List, batch_size: int = 64, n_epochs: int = 30, n_replicas: int = 1, outpath: str = 'unsupervised_tuner_search') → Union[bool, Tuple[Any, Any]]

Define the search space using keras-tuner and bayesian optimization

Parameters

  • train (-) – dataset to train the model on

  • test (-) – dataset to validate the model on

  • hypertun_trials (-) – number of Bayesian optimization iterations to run

  • hpt_type (-) – specify one of Bayesian Optimization (bayopt) and Hyperband (hyperband)

  • k (-) –

  • loss (-) – one of [ELBO, MMD, ELBO+MMD]

  • overlap_loss (-) – assigns as weight to an extra loss term which

  • components (penalizes overlap between GM) –

  • phenotype_class (-) – adds an extra regularizing neural network to the model,

  • comes (which tries to predict the phenotype of the animal from which the sequence) –

  • predictor (-) – adds an extra regularizing neural network to the model,

  • one (which tries to predict the next frame from the current) –

  • project_name (-) – ID of the current run

  • callbacks (-) – list of callbacks for the training loop

  • n_epochs (-) – optional. Number of epochs to train each run for

  • n_replicas (-) – optional. Number of replicas per parameter set. Higher values will yield more robust results, but will affect performance severely

Returns

dictionary with the best retrieved hyperparameters - best_run (tf.keras.Model): trained instance of the best model found

Return type

  • best_hparams (dict)
